alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Webster; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 23 at 6:48PM CDT until March 24 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Douglas County in southwestern Missouri... Southeastern Webster County in southwestern Missouri... Southern Wright County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 100 AM CDT Friday. * At 648 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mountain Grove, Ava, Mansfield, Norwood, Brushyknob, Dogwood, Goodhope, Drury and Vanzant. This includes the following low water crossings... Cowskin Creek at Highway Y, Beaver Creek at County Road 524, Wolf Creek at Highway AB, Bryant Creek at County Road 223, Bryant Creek at Highway U, Little Beaver Creek at County Road 447 and Fox Creek at County Road 246. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
